files.README.md:
# GPU CLI Plugin for Claude Code

Claude Code skills for running ML applications on cloud GPUs with [GPU CLI](https://github.com/gpu-cli/gpu).

## Features

- **Proactive GPU Suggestions** - Claude automatically suggests GPU CLI when you're working with CUDA code, see OOM errors, or need to train models
- **Complete Command Reference** - All `gpu run`, `gpu status`, `gpu inventory` commands documented
- **Configuration Guide** - Full `gpu.toml` reference with all options
- **Troubleshooting** - Common issues and solutions for GPU provisioning
- **Examples** - Ready-to-use templates for ComfyUI, training, and more

## Installation

### From GPU CLI Marketplace (Recommended)

```bash
# Add the GPU CLI marketplace
claude plugin marketplace add gpu-cli/marketplace

# Install the plugin
claude plugin install gpu-cli
```

### Local Development

```bash
# Clone and use directly
git clone https://github.com/gpu-cli/llm-agent
claude --plugin-dir ./llm-agent
```

## What's Included

### Skills

- **gpu-cli** - Core GPU CLI usage including:
  - Installation and authentication
  - Running commands on cloud GPUs
  - Port forwarding for web UIs
  - Background jobs and interactive sessions
  - GPU selection and inventory
  - Output syncing configuration
  - Model pre-downloading
  - Complete gpu.toml reference

## Usage

Once installed, Claude automatically discovers these skills. Just ask:

- "How do I install GPU CLI?"
- "Run my Python script on a cloud GPU"
- "Why is my pod not starting?"
- "Add FLUX models to my project"
- "What GPUs are available under $1/hr?"
- "How do I run ComfyUI on a cloud GPU?"

Claude will also proactively suggest GPU CLI when it sees:
- CUDA/PyTorch code that needs a GPU
- CUDA out of memory errors
- Model training or inference workloads

## Requirements

- [GPU CLI](https://gpu-cli.sh) installed
- RunPod API key configured (`gpu auth login`)

## Contributing

PRs welcome! Add new skills to `skills/` directory.

## Changelog

### 1.1.0

- Added proactive GPU CLI suggestions when CUDA code or OOM errors are detected
- Complete command reference from `--help` output
- Full `gpu.toml` configuration reference
- Enhanced troubleshooting section
- Added examples for training, ComfyUI, and web UIs
- Added quick reference card

### 1.0.0

- Initial release with basic GPU CLI documentation
